  (41,47)       2.500000000000000e+08
  (43,47)       2.399285294510000e+06
  (47,47)       9.616798488040000e+08
  (48,47)      -1.097797313320000e+08
  (13,48)       2.758284706830000e+05
  (17,48)      -5.571735107790000e+07
  (18,48)       1.094119600380000e+07
  (19,48)       2.083333333330000e+06
  (24,48)       1.000000000000000e+08
  (42,48)      -2.500000000000000e+06
  (43,48)       1.408381959840000e+05
  (47,48)      -1.097797313320000e+08
  (48,48)       5.312781037750000e+08


Task:
1. Write C program, which will realise the the matrix/vector
   multiplication G*b with G formed as the full matrix (without
   exploiting the sparsity) in two versions:
   a) fully sequential,
   b) using the broadcasting technique in the OpenMPI
      environment. Take vector b constructed as follows:
      b = [ 1, 2, 1, 2, ... , 1, 2, 1, 2 ]^T
2. Write C program, which will realise the the matrix/vector
   multiplication G*b with G formed expoliting the sparsity in
   two versions:
   a) fully sequential,
   b) using the broadcasting technique in the OpenMPI
      environment. Take vector b constructed as follows:
      b = [ 1, 2, 1, 2, ... , 1, 2, 1, 2 ]^T
3. Compare execution times for all four versions.
